data.title: Minnesota Now: Aug. 7, 2024
data.meta_description: Listen to the full show here.
data.text:
The political battle for the Midwest is center stage Wednesday with dueling presidential campaign events. Minnesota Now heard reports from a Harris-Walz rally, attracting thousands and a smaller JD Vance campaign event, both in Eau Claire, Wis.

MPR News host Cathy Wurzer took a deeper dive into Harris’ decision to choose Walz as a running mate and how it affects the ticket.

MPR chief meteorologist Paul Huttner joined the show to recap some destructive storms that have made way for a calm weather pattern for the rest of the week.

One of the most plentiful meteor showers of the year is in full swing. The show covered how and where to watch.

Our summer festival spotlight took us west to the Minnesota Garlic Festival in Hutchinson to learn about the unique traditions of celebrating the plant.

The Minnesota Music Minute was ‘Paranoid’ by Hippocampus and the Song of the Day was ‘Ain’t Spring for Me’ by Tim Emmons.

Use the audio player above to listen to the full conversation.
